title_description: LAMISA UG APARADOR TRADING SERVICES (LuA) is an offspring of Rattan Center International, Inc. (RCII) a firm engaged in manufacturing and export of fine quality furnishings for more than a quarter century. The LuA division was created to go back to where we began that is, to serve the local Philippine market.

name: Moalboal Tropics
address:
Brgy. Paramayon, Poblacion East, Moalboal, Cebu, Cebu City, Cebu, Philippines
View Map
title_description:
Newly built hotel-resort in the center town of Moalboal, Cebu where everything is within reach. Accessible to famous tourist spots just like Kawasan Falls, canyoneering, white beach, and whale shark watching. Be adventurous with different water activities like snorkeling, diving and canyoneering. Witness the amazing "sardines run". Be greeted with colorful fishes, rare corals and sea creatures which can be found here in Moalboal.



Every rooms in the hotel are fully air conditioned, has LED cable tv, hot or cold shower, linens, towels. Free Wi-Fi and wide parking are offered. We warmly welcome you and be our guest.

name: Costabella Tropical Beach Hotel
address:
Buyong Mactan Lapu-Lapu City, 6015, Cebu
View Map
title_description: Costabella Tropical Beach is a beachfront resort hotel in Cebu that lies on the scenic coastline of Mactan Island in Southern Philippines. Just a short distance from Cebu City, with warm tropical weather, good swimming, nice dive spots, and a variety of outdoor activities, the Resort Hotel in Cebu of Costabella offers island holiday essentials.

name: Badian Island Resort and Spa
address:
Cebu Capitol Commercial Complex-A N. Escario Street , 6000, Cebu
View Map
title_description: The natural beauty of the island - with its picturesque location just off the Southwest Coast of Cebu - warmly embraces its visitors on their arrival. Here, the resort’s lush palms speckle the private sandy beach that slowly slips into the azure lagoon. A white tongue of sand whisks you out into an inspiring world between heaven and ocean. Fishing outriggers slip silently past the enchanting silhouette of the Mountains of Cebu, an atmosphere worth more than ten thousand words.

title_description: If you're travelling outside the Philippines, we can provide you with excellent products and services to suit your travel needs. Either alone or with a group, for business or leisure, BAL Tours manage every detail of your trip and we design special tour programs to meet your exacting requirements.

title_description: Excellent scuba diving, a relaxed ambience, fine dining - this is what you can expect at Sole e Mare Beach Resort here in Moalboal on the island of Cebu in the Philippines. The Sole e Mare Beach Resort caters foremost to the active scuba diver, snorkeler and water sport enthusiast.

title_description: Derived from the Spanish word that means mooring rope used to anchor ships at port, Amara connotes home where a family will find safe harbor.To Cebuanos, Amara is the one seaside haven where you can rejuvenate your spirit and the ties that bind your family, where life is renewed by the sea, the surrounding natural environs and a 100-year old lighthouse that beams a guiding light faithfully every night.

reviewer_text:
[{"reviewer_text":"Me and my husband booked the submarine+cebu city tour last minute with KR travels in Cebu. The total charge for the two of us was ~15000 pesos. This included an aircon vehichle, a tour guide, entrance fee and lunch for both of us. We were under the impression that the submarine ride is the one that's increasing the price by so much( a city tour would have costed us ~3000 pesos) but upon our arrival we found that the submarine was actually costing 5000 pesos for two people only.The guide seemed to be uninformed of the places and failed to tell us the clear history of each monument. The city visit sites are all extremely close to each other and it absolutely did not make sense to us to pay so much for the tour, but we had already succumbed to the trap. Also at the start of the tour, we informed the guide that we are both vegetarians so our lunch should be vegetarian. But he took us to a seafood restaurant and then insisted that this is what we have. Then when we called the tour organizer she said that since we had not informed her about our vegetarian choice, we wont' be getting anything. After haggling so much we finally asked her to refund the money for lunch(initally she said 500 pesos for two which is extremely low, but finally we got her to agree to 1000 pesos for two ppl). Overall as tourists we feel cheated and mistreated. Highly disappointed. our overall philippines tour was excellent but i regret hiring them for our tour."},{"reviewer_text":"Dear KR Travel and Tours.and Employees,



Beth and I would like to complement everyone on the splendid job you all did in organizing and running the tour we had the privilege in taking. It would be unfair to single out anyone in particular because everyone carried out their duties to a “five star” level. I cannot express to you how delighted we were in the tour itself and the organization behind it. To say it went off like clockwork would be an understatement. We have already recommended KR Travel and Tours to some off our friends and will continue to recommend the use of KR to anyone we know who may wish to visit the Philippines, and we will certainly use KR again in the future.Please feel free to use or quote us in any advertising or promotional way in order to enhance KR Travel and Tours.



Once again many thanks for a fantastic time.



S & B Carr

Sydney Australia"}]

address:
Tugbungan, Pilipog, Cordova, 6017, Cebu
View Map
title_description: Located near the village of Pilipog, a happy and safe suburb of Cebu. The resort is a short 9 KM drive (We suggest you let us arrange transport from the airport before you arrive. The price is only 350 pesos (about $8 USD) which is usually cheaper than if you try to hire a taxi or car on your own. We also suggest you bring our phone number with you, incase you need to call us from the airport.) From Mactan International Airport and only 10KM from Cebu. The resort offers 24 hour professional security so that guests can enjoy absolute peace of mind, away from the cares of every day life, and let Parkside Alta Cebu resort become your sanctuary of rejuvenation.

reviewer_text: [{"reviewer_text":"been there and the place is awesome... very good for R&R... away from the hustle and bustle of City life... When you're here in Cebu Philippines, be sure to drop by Virgin Beach Resort Cebu... Kudos Ron"},{"reviewer_text":"This place was just what I expected after visiting their web site. It was indeed peaceful and quiet and out of the way and off the beaten path. There were no crowds there and no noise. The rooms were clean and price was low. The staff was helpful and friendly and the food was delicious. Not a lot of white sand at the beach, but it was exactly like in the pictures, so I wasn't disappointed. The website and the menu said to put in your order early as they do not have any items pre-prepared and everything is made fresh. Only took about 20 minutes so that was great. If you are looking for a quiet place away from it all, then this place is for you."}]

title_description: The City of Makati has a population of 524,000, according to the 2000 Census of Population conducted by the National Statistics Office (NSO). This figure represents an increase of 39,824 or 8 per cent over the 1995 figure. Among cities and municipalities in Metro Manila, Makati ranks fifth in population, with a 5 percent share.In a span of 97 years, Makati's population grew 193 times. The 1903 Census placed the population at 2,700.Based on the 1995 Census of Population, the 20 barangays comprising Makati's First District have a combined population of 230,726, while the 13 barangays of the Second District have a combined population of 253,450. Barangay Pembo has the largest population, with 62,097 while the least populated barangay is Urdaneta with 3,575.
